full_product_name.product_name: cyrus-imapd-0:3.0.7-20.el8_4.1 as a component of Red Hat Enterprise Linux AppStream (v. 8)

notes.note: cyrus-imapd: Denial of service via string hashing algorithm collisions

reference.description: bz#1993232: CVE-2021-33582 cyrus-imapd: Denial of service via string hashing algorithm collisions

remediation.description:
For details on how to apply this update, which includes the changes described in this advisory, refer to:
https://access.redhat.com/articles/11258

note:
An update for cyrus-imapd is now available for Red Hat Enterprise Linux 8.
Red Hat Product Security has rated this update as having a security impact of Important. A Common Vulnerability Scoring System (CVSS) base score, which gives a detailed severity rating, is available for each vulnerability from the CVE link(s) in the References section.

The Cyrus IMAP server provides access to personal mail, system-wide bulletin boards, news-feeds, calendar and contacts through the IMAP, JMAP, NNTP, CalDAV and CardDAV protocols.
Security Fix(es):
* cyrus-imapd: Denial of service via string hashing algorithm collisions (CVE-2021-33582)
For more details about the security issue(s), including the impact, a CVSS score, acknowledgments, and other related information, refer to the CVE page(s) listed in the References section.
